etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Marnettè's Perfect Cook. From un- + creamed

definitions: Of milk, fresh cheese, etc.: from which none of the cream has been removed; unskimmed; full-cream, full-fat.
Originally of coffee or tea: served without cream or milk; black. Later also of food, especially a cooked vegetable: not mashed, mixed, flavoured, etc., with cream or milk.
Of cheese: low in fat, either because no cream has been added to it or because it has been made from skimmed milk; specifically (of cottage cheese) not having the curds combined with cream or milk.
